job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant CNA in Phila, PA
pros: Good for experience in patient care/ healthcare
cons: As a PRN, I didn't get annual raises like everyone else

review_title: Learned quickly that the long time docs control admin,  who have no idea how to run a hospital.
pros: My co- workers made most days bearable.
cons: The the doctors are treated like kings,  while keeping the staff there on standby, often after their shift has ended,  for whatever whim they may come up with.  Managers expect so much from the skeleton crew they use as their staffing ratio.  Constantly running out of equipment. And the fighting between union shop Temple, who owns Jeanes, and the non union Jeane's admin is uncomfortable.  Good luck finding a good night shift nurse on 4b. And the  newer 2c unit is a joke. Their ICU is very small,  so any large practice immediately over looks Jeanes due to the lack of a neuro ICU, CVICU, and no step down.

job_title: Snack Shop Aide in Philadelphia, PA
pros: It's your typical hospital.  The pay is reasonable and your schedule varies on who your supervisor is.  Overall a nice place.
cons: There is favoritism.  You will find that just about anywhere you go but this is one thing that really bothers me.

review_title: Great place to start; similar to most other places if you're working low level jobs

pros:

cons:

job_title: Certified Nursing Assistant in Philadelphia, PA
pros: Management on my unit is great. Most co workers are nice.
cons: Low paying compared to other hospitals in the area. Pretty much no break on a 12 hour over night shift. Treated like less due to job title
